event.title: Dubbed as the "Golden West" in the 1960s

data.event: Dubbed as the "Golden West" in the 1960s and early 70s, Bani lies between Tambac Bay and West Philippine Sea.
Bani was founded on March 18, 1769 (from Zambales).
In May 1903, it was transferred to Pangasinan together with the towns of Agno, Alaminos, Anda, Bolinao, Burgos, Dasol, Infanta and Mabini.

event.title: Immaculate Conception, Patron Saint of San Simon, disappeared

data.event: The Immaculate Conception, Patron Saint of San Simon, disappeared from the church altar and discovered on top of the tall Bani tree in the vicinity of the present Church.
